newsitem.title: GERMANY: Ludewig to take over at German railways in July.
newsitem.headline: Ludewig to take over at German railways in July.

text.p: The supervisory board of German state railways Deutsche Bahn AG has nominated Johannes Ludewig, state secretary in the Economics Ministry, to take over as chief executive in July.

A Deutsche Bahn spokeswoman said Ludewig would join the board on May 1 and would move into the top job on July 9. The German government will propose that current CEO Heinz Duerr moves into the supervisory board.
The appointment of Ludewig, a senior adviser to Chancellor Helmut Kohl, was confirmed by government officials on Monday.
